intro: Eragrostis flavicans, commonly known as the yellow panicgrass, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, grass-like foliage and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its attractive golden hue and drought tolerance. Eragrostis flavicans is also valued for its potential in erosion control and as a forage crop in arid regions.
